title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.16.20 part 4 | 27-01-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyanati Miran Dasya Gyananj Nishalakaya Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: What is the reason for all suffering in this material world is our sinful activities.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the degradation in Kali Yuga due to godlessness and faithlessness, emphasizing the importance of performing yajna to become free from sinful reactions.

segments.key_quote: If work is done as sacrifice, as it is directed in the authentic scriptures, then you don't become bound up by sinful reactions.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that performing work as a sacrifice, as directed in scriptures, prevents one from being bound by sinful reactions and suffering.

segments.key_quote: Follow the injunctions of the scriptures, and perform work as yajna.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the importance of following scriptural injunctions and performing work as yajna to avoid suffering and sinful reactions, highlighting the Varnashrama system.

segments.key_quote: By eating Krishna prasadam, you are purified of the old reactions.
segments.summary: The speaker explains how eating vegetarian food offered to Krishna (prasadam) purifies one from past sinful reactions and prevents new ones.

segments.key_quote: Proper rainfall is possible only by performance of yajna.
segments.summary: The speaker connects sacrifice to proper rainfall and food production, contrasting this with the practices of 'mlechas' who misuse resources by feeding grains to livestock and then slaughtering them.

segments.key_quote: There is severe sinful reactions for cow killing.
segments.summary: The speaker condemns the unnecessary killing of animals, especially cows, and emphasizes that spiritual culture can lead to a peaceful, happy, and sin-free life.

segments.key_quote: Sacrifice means to please Vishnu and how to please Vishnu by practice of bhakti yoga
segments.summary: The speaker advocates for Bhakti Yoga as the most feasible sacrifice in Kali Yuga, particularly chanting Hare Krishna, hearing the Bhagavatam, and offering vegetarian food to Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Chanting Hare Krishna does not demand any qualification.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the accessibility of chanting Hare Krishna, stating that it requires no prior qualification, and reiterates the importance of eating only vegetarian food offered to Krishna.

segments.key_quote: This Krishna consciousness is the way for actually becoming free from all sinful activities, purifying our old sinful reactions and ushering in peace and prosperity for ourselves and everyone else.
segments.summary: The speaker provides detailed instructions on how to prepare and offer vegetarian food to Krishna, explaining how partaking of the remnants (prasadam) purifies one and leads to peace and prosperity.
